snippet: In the aftermath of the disappearance of 43 college students, order is disintegrating in Mexico’s most violent state.
abstract: Residents in Mexico's Guerrero State have lost all faith in police and military since disappearance of 43 college students in September 2014; frustration with inability of authorities to curb drug gangs and organized crime is prompting many communities to seize control of their own security; activists are vowing to disrupt coming elections in name of missing students.
lead_paragraph: In the aftermath of the disappearance of 43 college students, order is disintegrating in Mexico’s most violent state.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Escuela Normal Rural Raul Isidro Burgos (Guerrero, Mexico)
